title.narrative: Mothers' Union Child Survival & Savings with Education 2015 Diocese of Angola

description.narrative: 2.1 TRAIN: Provide new and refresher trainings for 3 Health Agents and 15 Savings with Education Activists (Volunteers) in Songo.,2.2 FORM: Promote the formation of Savings with Education Groups among existing community/faith-based groups in Songo.,2.3 FACILITATE: Facilitate new Savings with Education Groups to create 7 Rules and begin regular savings, lending and financial management activities in Songo.,2.4 INTEGRATE: Encourage new Savings with Education Groups to integrate into group meetings special time for health education dialogues (via FASA discovery or new NfL methodologies).,1.2 FORM: Promote the formation of Savings with Education Groups among existing women's health learning groups and/or other community/faith-based groups in Luanda and Uige.,1.3 FACILITATE: Facilitate Savings with Education Groups to create 7 Rules and begin regular savings, lending and financial management activities.,1.4 MONITOR: Follow-up on existing (2nd year and 3rd year) Savings with Education Groups to learn from their maturing activities and to collect their current savings data.,1.1 TRAIN: Provide new and refresher trainings for Savings with Education Agents and Replicators in Luanda and Uige.,3.1 Develop Job Descriptions & Contracts for each Savings Agent, Activist, Technical Assistant and MU staff person.,3.2 Review and translate Savings Agent Payment Policy document and share with all Savings Agents.,3.4 Develop an MU Project governance structure and organizational chart and demonstrate how it fits within the wider Diocesan structure and organizational chart.,3.5 Translate program introduction / overview / promotional document into Portuguese for Angolan networking activities.,3.3 Participate in training on Diocesan Admin & Financial procedures.,3.6 Participate in exchange visits and/or national conferences for increased program visibility and staff growth.,3.7 Increase Mothers' Union visibility and project sustainability through the diversification of project funding sources, for example reinvestment of Mothers' Union self-financing funds, and new donor/technical partners.

2015 Program Goal: The current goal of the Angola Mothers’ Union Child Survival program is to facilitate the transformation and empowerment of Angolan women to reinforce their contribution toward a reduction in the morbidity and mortality of their children, an increase in their economic independence in their families, and an overall improvement in the environment and public health of their communities. The 2014-2018 Strategic Plan of the Angola Mothers’ Union Savings with Education program targets the formation of 520 Savings with Education Groups throughout five provinces. This 2015 plan therefore proposes to support the Mothers’ Union in their expanded work toward this goal and the growth of the new Savings with Education component through the initiation and/or reinforcement of 90 Savings with Education groups (36 in Luanda, 33 in Uige, and 21 in Songo; 11 3rd year, 33 2nd year, 46 New; facilitated by at total to 22 Agents, 1 Supervisor, 1 Coordinator and 3 Replicators ).

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
